message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.NE, cs.LG 

This paper discusses the development of embodied dialogue agents that can interact with the environment through verbal and non-verbal communication. The paper reviews research on language acquisition, comprehension, and production, and argues that these processes cannot be accurately replicated without taking into account the architecture of the human brain and embodiment. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-categories of natural language processing (cs.CL), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), robotics (cs.RO), neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE), and machine learning (cs.LG).
